problem_text:
Let H(q, c) = ⟨a, b, c, d | [b, a] = [d, c], of exponent q, nilpotent of class c⟩.
a) Is it true that the Schur multiplier M(H(8, 12)) has exponent 32?
b) Is it true that the Schur multiplier M(H(7, 13)) has exponent 49?
The difficulty is that these groups are too big to compute using current versions
of the p-Quotient Algorithm, which use 32 bit arithmetic. So to tackle these groups
it would help to have a version of the p-Quotient Algorithm using 64 bit arithmetic.
M. R. Vaughan-Lee
